llm_text:
Why: The model flag is primarily driven by payment_format_ach (value=1) which has the largest positive SHAP (2.8217), indicating ACH payment format strongly increased the score. payment_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1, SHAP=0.6265) and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1, SHAP=0.4086) further increased the score, as did dayofweek (value=6, SHAP=0.6067) and amount_received (value=71485.3, SHAP=0.4885). Offsetting these increases, from_bank (value=149345, SHAP=-0.7022) and to_bank (value=148586, SHAP=-0.4235) reduced the score.

Conclusion: The transaction was flagged mainly because it is an ACH transfer (payment_format_ach=1) in Saudi riyal (payment_currency_saudi_riyal=1 and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal=1) on dayofweek=6 with a sizable amount (amount_received=71485.3); bank IDs (from_bank and to_bank) partially mitigated the model signal. If the model associates ACH + SAR + Sunday + this amount with higher risk, that combination explains the alert.
